reviews.title: Pure heaven
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived at dusk on a very foggy night after driving 4 hours from Rome. The La Foce estate seemed like a dream. Our house was just past the castle, Belvedere 1. It was one of the old farmhouses and was very spacious with 3 bedrooms and three bathrooms.

reviews.title: La Foce Has it All
reviews.text: Cheese, salami, bread and wine from a local vineyard waited for us. . We opted for "first shopping" too which meant the fridge was stocked with all the essentials - bread, eggs, butter, coffee, etc.

The house was decorated very tastefully and was in keeping with the rustic, Tuscan appeal of the area. The views were INSANE. Cypress lined roads on crete hills. Lush gardens. Twisted vineyards. It truly was pure heaven.
reviews.title: Fabulous La Foce

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week in the Fonte room at Chiarentana before heading to London for the Olympics. Our flat was very spacious for two people, with 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room and bedroom. We booked both the welcome and the final dinner and both were delicious and definitely recommend, especially the welcome dinner as its a nice way to meet the people you will spend the week with. We also took part in the cocktail dinner and concert series on the Sunday night. There has been a lot written about the Origo family and what they have don' for Val D'Orcia but we didn't really appreciate it until we spent time there. This is what stands La Foce apart from other villas - a very special place.
reviews.title: A blissful stay

reviews.text: This spacious villa was awesome and is great for families. I believe it can sleep up to 14, but we had a couple fewer at 9 and it was a great size. Rec Room with Ping Pong in the basement. Private pool on the property was great to retire to after a bit of exploration earlier in the day. A true relief to have in the hot Tuscan Sun. The property also has a side annex house, which is quite lovely.
reviews.title: Sassaia Villa - Awesome week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many places to hang out, inside the house and outside. Probably my favorite was the outdoor, open, pergola, vined dining area...aside from the first night, we always had meals outside here. Given the chance and opportunity, I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Chiarentana Honeymoon was Wonderful!!!!

reviews.text: We chose La Foce based on distance from the Chianti region however, after booking our villa we did some research on the area and never felt the need to travel near Chianti. The room was great, we stayed in Casa del Bersagliere. I would highly recomend choosing the option to have a meal waiting for you! Being that it was in the off season we were the only couple at Chiarentana but there is staff and the owners family that reside there but they were seldom seen.
reviews.title: La Foce is fantastic!

reviews.text: One concern we had was the heating bill that was quoted as possibly being up to 300 Euro. It did get a little cold at night outside but with firewood only costing 15 Euro we heated with it and ended up with a 30 Euro gas bill. We did learn a chilly lesson our first morning, if the heat is not running there is no hot water!
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I rented a one bedroom apartment in Chiantara. It was extremely comfortable for the two of us. The grounds of La Foce are beautiful with wonderful views everywhere. We visited many nearby towns, but also enjoyed spending a day just walking around the estate or sitting outside to admire the views when we returned. We've rented other apartments in Tuscany, but this was the nicest. It was great to have the advantage of the extremely helpful staff. The office was open each morning, and the manager provided helpful answers to all questions. We went to both the first night and last night dinners and enjoyed them. The food is typically Tuscan and very good.
reviews.title: Incredibly beautiful and wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Foce seems to be a closely guarded secret place...returned to year after year by familes, friends and colleagues who like the fact that they can claim it as their own. We visited this year the week following the eruption of Iceland's famous volcano... and were greeted by Benadetta and advised and then amazed by the fact that we actually had the whole beautiful place to ourselves - because international travelers from countries far and wide could not reach Italy. The whole experience was amazing. Our three room apartment - with 1.5 bathes - was perfect for the two of us. Our delicious welcoming dinner was prepared for us in out apartment because there was no one else to share it.- we dine well in Italy and this was the best food we had the entire three week trip - including a week spend on a six star luxury cruise to Croatia and Greece. The grounds and gardens are absolutely beautiful - being groomed in spring for their summer splendor. La Foce is the perfect place from which to base Tuscan travels. It's relatively remote, very quiet (not suitable for those who like/need city hustle and bustle), it's pleasantly removed from elbow-to-elbow tourists but affords vistas, walking trails, biking, hiking and riding opportunities as far as the eye can see.
reviews.title: Best of Tuscany

reviews.text: Totally lives up to all the reviews!! La Foce was fantastic for a rustic Tuscan vacation with our 3 small children. Staff were so kind and helpful and the grounds are beautiful. I couldn't stop staring at our marvelous view. Take the time to drive around and explore all the lovely small villages. The unexpected small things are what you will most remember-- for us, it was the sheep crossing on our way to Pienza and the large package of vanilla wafers the kids purchased for just 50 Euros in Radicofani. The labyrinth in Chiusi was super cool for the kids (and spooky for me), but be sure to check the tour times as they are infrequent. Wish we could've seen the tombs and catacombs, but we didn't time it right. Be sure to visit Osteria Aquavechia in Montepulciano for a unique dining experience and La Porta- Daria is as wonderful as all the bloggers say. Italy was hard to leave- it really is a little bit of heaven on earth.
reviews.title: Lives up to all the wonderful reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For families with small children, I recommend staying at Chianterena (sp?) at La Foce. Pool is better for little kids and trampoline and small playground were a fun surprise for them.
reviews.title: Great location and stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Foce is a lovely spot and a great location for touring the area. The gardens at the main villa are exceptionally beautiful and not to be missed. The four bedroom house we rented was spotless, well maintained, and absolutely quite with lovely views. I had a few small nits: the cook we hired through La Foce was OK but not great, the staff could have been a bit more engaged and helpful, and internet service should be more available (just one computer available!)
reviews.title: Nothing else like it

reviews.text: My 5 friends and I rented the Bellvedere II, one of several converted old stone buildings, in the complex of La Foce near Chianciano, Tuscany. The house has 4 bedrooms and bathrooms, with a lovely kitchen, pool, and garden. The view out to the valley is a dream. There are beautiful walks on the extended property, and charming hill towns are a short drive away.
reviews.title: Tuscany dream

reviews.text: We spent a week in Beco, a part of Chiarentana of the La Foce estate. The road leading to Chiarentana is terrible. It is a dirt road wich goes up and down, has big holes and it felt like we could slide of it at every moment. After this trail however we arrived at our castle. The garden is great! At night we took out a candle, a bottle of wine and just looked at the stars and enjoyed the peace. Great views and an super pool with comfy chairs.
reviews.title: Chiarentana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even a bbq is available. The interior was nice. Big and superequipped kitchen, two bathrooms with soaps and more than enough towels. No airco but the Tuscan houses don't realy need it. If you keep everything closed in the day it cools of enough at night. Mrs Isidori was very friendly and answered all our questions. She seemed to know a nice restaurant in every town. La Foce is not so centrally located. Firenze, Siena, Pisa, Lucca were all a long drive away (1,5hours minimum). But there are more than enough villages to discover nearby. Montepulciano, Bagno san filippo, Chianciano.....
reviews.title: a fascinating place

reviews.text: We stayed at La Foce for a week this August. Because we had read many books by and about Iris Origo, the founder, we had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Would Never Stay Anywhere Else in Tuscany!

reviews.text: We stayed in Chiarentana, a 14 c. stone building that used to house many peasant families and their animals. It is now re-done ,partly occupied by the Origo family and also contains 7 apartments. Our 2-bedroom apt. was spacious and the kitchen particularly well-appointed. Other rooms were comfortable, but dark.
reviews.title: A week at the Castle
